item.title: New Brexit carve-out urged for legacy EU cleared swaps
item.description: Risk and default management of grandfathered portfolios required in any clearing relocation plan

item.title: Large corporates unconvinced by Emir reporting gift
item.description: Corporates ask for opt-out from Emir reporting changes proposed for their benefit

item.title: US dealers wade into European CCP relocation debate
item.description: CFTC hearing warns of increased margining costs and a pre-Brexit client onboarding crunch

item.title: Doubts plague Emir reporting clean-up
item.description: Industry still advocates single-sided reporting as a way to improve EU swaps data quality

item.title: Emir reporting relief for ETDs causes confusion
item.description: Market participants unsure who will report client-side leg of exchange-traded derivatives trades to CCPs

item.title: Emir review could push securitisations into the dark
item.description: Subjecting deals to margin requirements would be a further blow to STS securitisation concept

item.title: Banks win concessions in battle over CCP margin models
item.description: European Commission proposal would shine light on clearing house margin charges

item.title: Esma wants more detail on CCP recovery plans
item.description: Isda AGM: regulator and industry emphasise need for effective clearing house supervision

item.title: Euro clearing location paper due on June 28
item.description: Short precursor on Brexit-related initiative expected on May 4, alongside Emir review

item.title: Emir review delayed until June 7
item.description: Postponement increases risk of entangling the review with Brexit euro clearing debate

item.title: EC rebuffs euro clearing relocation policy in Emir review
item.description: UK pushes back against French demands to shift CCP business post-Brexit

item.title: EC could use thresholds to squeeze London euro clearing
item.description: Most euro clearing could be repatriated after Brexit without hitting other jurisdictions

item.title: Emir review could enable EU clearing land grab
item.description: Experts say 2015 ECJ ruling may not protect London euro clearing if the UK leaves the European Union

item.title: Final EU non-cleared margin rules softened for pension funds
item.description: No margin concentration limits for pension funds, but intragroup rules threaten US equivalence

item.title: EU non-cleared margin regime set to take effect in January 2017
item.description: EC expected to publish its final non-cleared margin rules on October 4

item.title: Esma buys time to fix broken client clearing chains
item.description: Two-year clearing delay for small firms might allow indirect model to be built

item.title: CCPs and Brexit: don’t forget the rest of the world
item.description: Brexit creates speculation CCPs will activate contingency plans if ECB mandates on euro-denominated trades

item.title: Not so fast, François: EU clearing land grab is complex
item.description: ECB cannot (yet) make post-Brexit demand for euro clearing to leave London

item.title: EU could go it alone on leverage ratio, says MEP
item.description: Swinburne says clearing should be shielded from ratio “if Basel does not deliver”

item.title: Emir countdown raises cost questions for the buy side
item.description: Firms fear wider spreads, lower liquidity after May 21 frontloading date

item.title: Questions remain after final EU uncleared margin rules
item.description: Industry gives a positive welcome, but the treatment of non-netting jurisdictions is still uncertain

item.title: EU banks plan to flee CME when key Emir date arrives
item.description: CCP oversight stand-off leaves banks in a bind as Feb 21 frontloading deadline nears

item.title: Ending Emir hedge exemption conflicts with Mifid II, firms say
item.description: EU energy firms warn Esma’s proposal to scrap the Emir hedge exemption would introduce a glaring inconsistency between Emir and Mifid II

item.title: Stricter EU collateral rules threaten Nordic power market
item.description: Tighter EU collateral standards set to come into force in March 2016 may hurt liquidity in Nordic electricity derivatives, market participants say

item.title: Mandatory EU clearing to start on June 21 for biggest firms
item.description: Rules on the central clearing of interest rate swaps are published in the EU's official journal

item.title: Europe edges closer to final Emir clearing timeline
item.description: Deadline could arrive in mid-June; pressure to resolve EU-US dispute grows

item.title: Irish central bank warns of swaps market shut-out
item.description: Official says current clearing capacity “will be saturated” by Emir demand

item.title: New firm to join EU derivatives repository melee
item.description: Two years into regime, Abide Financial targets trades it sends to Regis-TR

item.title: Esma delays EU clearing of Nordic currency swaps
item.description: Worries that EU banks would lose customers in non-EU member Norway are likely behind the hiatus

item.title: Expected delay to non-EU CCP approval risks frontloading panic
item.description: Lawyers predict many CCPs will remain in limbo by the current December 15 deadline, which overlaps with the start of frontloading and ups the pressure on banks ahead of clearing requirement from April 2016

item.title: End-users and banks seek radical change to Emir reporting
item.description: Dual-sided reporting in Europe is not producing accurate data. Banks and corporates say a single-sided approach will help, while also relieving end-users of operational burdens and costs, but some regulators are not convinced

item.title: Esma ‘determined’ to finalise Mifid II rules in September
item.description: Market has been expecting a delay; timeline will hinge on board meeting this week

item.title: Pension funds in limbo as EC leaves Emir exemption gap
item.description: Funds could be subject to CVA charge for period of weeks or months

item.title: Corporates fear end to Emir's hedge exemption
item.description: Counting all trades towards clearing threshold ‘would be a nightmare’

item.title: Esma urges EC to bin frontloading
item.description: Benefits of retroactive clearing are "undermined" by its drawbacks, Esma finds

item.title: Fresh delay will push EU-US CCP row into September
item.description: Decision had been expected in July; dealers sceptical new timeline will hold

item.title: Dealers seek equity derivatives carve-out from margin rules
item.description: Emir requirements may force dealers to reinvent synthetic equity finance trades

item.title: CCP wrangling sparks new frontloading fears
item.description: Dealers fear trades could be booked at CCPs they are not able to use

item.title: EC's Hill points to April 2016 start for swaps clearing
item.description: EC and Esma have agreed rules - legislators now have six months to endorse them

item.title: Norwegian adoption of Emir to fix cross-border clash
item.description: EU banks will be required to clear Nkr swaps – Norwegian banks currently are not

item.title: US vs EU CCP scrap may be settled by margin study
item.description: Isda AGM: CFTC and EC analysis aims to end wrangle over merits of 1-day and 2-day margin rules

item.title: EC calls for more time to vet foreign CCP oversight
item.description: Third extension "necessary and proportionate", says EC internal document

item.title: Banks welcome Esma clarification on foreign subsidiaries
item.description: Changes mean some guarantees will not count towards the threshold for compliance, reducing the chance of foreign subsidiaries outside EU being caught by Emir

item.title: Ice considers moving Brent contract to avoid EU margin hike
item.description: Ice says move is “not an outcome we want to see” but Emir margin could drive users away

item.title: Pension funds sign hedge-only agreements with banks
item.description: Cardano and PGGM promise not to give banks speculative trades as dealers try to limit complexity of EU’s pension fund clearing exemption

item.title: EU court to rule on UK challenge to ECB's clearing policy
item.description: Verdict due on March 4 in first of three UK complaints about eurozone clearing

item.title: Lawyers back Esma in clearing dispute with EC
item.description: Esma's objections to the EC's plan to exempt intragroup derivatives trades from clearing are on solid legal ground, say lawyers. But they warn it could further delay the start of clearing

item.title: EC to delay frontloading of cleared swaps
item.description: The European Commission has written to Esma, informing it of plans to change the frontloading timeline, with the intention of removing uncertainty in the controversial requirement

item.title: EC expected to amend frontloading timeline
item.description: The European Commission is expected to amend its frontloading timeline, say dealers, which could further delay the start of clearing in Europe

item.title: CFTC's Massad muddies waters in CCP oversight row
item.description: Industry hopes comments are aimed at European clearing houses but warns it could cause a new fight either way
